content: On June 22, 1984, the Atlanta Braves faced the San Francisco Giants in a memorable game where outfielder Dale Murphy showcased his power by hitting two home runs. Murphy's performance helped propel the Braves to a 6-4 victory at Atlanta-Fulton County Stadium. This game was part of Murphyâ€™s standout season, during which he would go on to win the National League MVP award for the second consecutive year.
